to.networld.schandler.security
Class AccessControl

java.lang.Object
  to.networld.schandler.security.AccessControl

public class AccessControl
extends java.lang.Object

Access Control class for the handling different checks if the card is permitted to access the system. Additional fine granulated access rights are returned.

Author:
Alex Oberhauser

Method Detail

getAccessRight

public AccessControl.ACL getAccessRight(BasicMifare _card)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
This method checks if the stored hash value on the card matches the key in the database. Additional a second database is queried to read out the access rights. If one of the two checks fails the method returns NULL.

Parameters:
_card - The card that is connected to the reader.
Returns:
The access rights as special enumeration block or if not permitted NULL.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkKey

public boolean checkKey(BasicMifare _card)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

changeKey

public boolean changeKey(BasicMifare _card)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Generates a random key and writes it to the internal structure and the SHA-512 value to the card.

Parameters:
_card - An element that represents the RFID card of the type Mifare 1K/4K.
Returns:
True if the changing was successful otherwise False
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

initNewCard

public boolean initNewCard(BasicMifare _card,
                           AccessControl.ACL _right)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
ATTENTION: This function is dangerous because you could initiate a card without checking if the calling program has rights to do so. Please assure on your own that only permitted entities are able to initiate a new card.

Parameters:
_card - The card that should be initiated.
Returns:
True if the procedure was successful, otherwise False.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
